intro: Jacquinia curvata, commonly known as the curvedleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has narrow, grass-like leaves that curve slightly at the tips. Jacquinia curvata is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial to full shade. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
